page.title: 15Outside Scunthorpe.
page.content: We went up to the bridge on New Dyke Road which crosses the M181 motorway to look around at the Trent Valley. This part of the motorway is a short spur road between Scunthorpe and the M180. Near the bridge is a pond where people can fish. We could see for about 10 miles all around. The flat land between the Trent and the hills called Scunthorpe Heights is good arable land. We could see where our school was in Scunthorpe because of the spire of the Church of the Holy Spirit sticking up against the sky. The church is just across the road from our school. Other buildings we could pick out were, the General Hospital, Technical College and the derelict Normanby Park steelworks. We could see the river's course by the cranes at Flixborough Wharf. Keadby Bridge was like a big roller-coaster.
